Andriy Yermak's resignation shocks Europe, but suits the US
subhead: With Volodymyr Zelensky's top aide stepping down, the EU loses a key interlocutor in Kyiv at a pivotal moment in peace talks. The Trump administration, by contrast, seems ready to leverage the crisis to push its own priorities.

subhead: The fire that devastated a residential complex in the new town of Taipo has claimed 128 lives so far. As the territory mourns, residents question the causes of the tragedy.

title: Travel chaos fears ease after Airbus implements software fix
subhead: French Transport Minister Philippe Tabarot said that the aircraft manufacturer had been able to correct the defect 'on more than 5,000 aircraft' on Friday and during the night from Friday to Saturday.

title: Inside the archives of shoemaker Roger Vivier
subhead: This star shoemaker of the 1930s through the 1990s spent his long career experimenting with all kinds of designs. His archives, a testament to his boundless creativity, are now housed in a Parisian hôtel particulier.

title: 'Help us talk about the body with our children': Sex and relationship workshops reach disadvantaged French neighborhoods
subhead: From talking about intimacy at home to learning about consent and exploring equality in relationships, the central city of Angoulême is fostering dialogue with residents in socio-economic difficulty.

Can French citizens be mobilized in the event of war?
subhead: Statements by General Fabien Mandon and President Emmanuel Macron's announcements about a voluntary national service have raised questions about a scenario that, until recently, seemed unimaginable.

title: The difficult conversations between Israeli and Palestinian peace activists
subhead: The anti-occupation NGO Combatants for Peace works to organize joint actions between young people living in the West Bank and in Israel. The group faces the challenge of rebuilding trust between both sides, torn apart by two years of war in Gaza.

title: Forgotten Louvre security report highlighted specific balcony used by crown jewel thieves
subhead: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.
